title: 820-00923 not charging.
message:
820-00923 no water damage,
came with short on PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO, i was replaced UB300 and UB400, now the Mac is on but not charging.
20v 0.6a with good know battery.
working fine just with charger or just with battery.
PPBUS with battery 10.6v.

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message:
Is the battery percentage reported correctly?
Check voltage and diode mode at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message:
yes the correct percentage.
charger and battery connected:
SMBUS__2/3_SDA_Q 0V  2 is O.L / 3 is 500
SMBUS__2/3_SCL_Q 0V  2 is O.L / 3 is 500
SMBUS__SMC_5_G3_SCL 3.4V
SMBUS__SMC_5_G3_SDA 3.4V
SMBUS__SMC_4_G3H_SDA/SCL 3.4 600
SMBUS__SMC_2_S4_SDA/SCL 0V O.L

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message:
"charger and battery connected"
Did you check in diode mode with power applied on the board?

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message: NO of course not.. just the voltage measuring

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message:
"SMBUS__SMC_5_G3_SCL 3.4V
SMBUS__SMC_5_G3_SDA 3.4V"
Did you see any other lines connected to battery bus?
Don't waste time with irrelevant measurments.
Post diode mode to ground...

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message: do you mean all the BUS/MBUS lines?

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message:
NO man.
Do you have more than two lines on battery bus???

Post diode mode...

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message:
wait there is new news..
the mac TURN ON just with charger and charger with battery "alone" (without the battery data cable).
but with the battery data cable is NOT turn on. 
the battery is fine with 100% charge was checking with other board.

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message:
SMBUS__SMC_5_G3_SCL 400
SMBUS__SMC_5_G3_SDA 400

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message:
Check Q7065 for short D-S.
Also check ohm resistance over C7020.

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message: all good (compare with good board)

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message: Do you get 2 ohm over C7020 for sure?

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message: 2.5ohm good and bad boards

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message: Check J6951 and its flex for corrosion.

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message:
NO..
The story is that the customer replaced by himself the battery and then it was not turn on.. 
the damage:
UB300 and UB400 was burned out i was replaced them and then this is the situation..
i have another good board to compare but i can find the problem 🤦‍♂️

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message: Check for knocked off components, or broken traces.

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message: when i connect the battery and turn in on , the voltmeter show 20v 1.4a and i see for one sec the backlight and is down to 20v 0.8a

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message:
suddenly im able to turn in on with battery but its not charging,  5V 1.4A.
can be ISL or something from the UB300/400 area?

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message: Check SMC_USBC_INT_L.

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message: SMC_USBC_INT_L -  3.4v   300

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message:
Try first changing U7000.
If still the same, change SMC.

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message:
replaced both still the same.. with battery data cable 5v 1.4a without 20v 1.2a and working..
the mac recognized the battery but it gave the cable sign instead the  lightning sign.

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message: Check Q7030/40 and traces...

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message: TBA_GATE_Q4 didnt get 13v so i was replaced Q7040 now there is 13V on TBA_GATE_Q4 but still the same 20v 0.8a charger with battery(before its turn on) is its on is 5v 1.4a

title: 820-00923 not charging.
message:
Did you remove and check Q7030 too?
You can easy check an MOSFET (out of board), if open/close its channel.
Be aware of R/C7030/40 also.
